artist: Artist: Attributed to Franz Anton Maulbertsch
description: architectural element with cartouche with three short lines of text; musical allegorical female figures standing at right and left flanking cartouche and reclining at top left; two putti at bottom center and upper right; standing woman at left holds horn (or dagger?) and covers her face with grey drapery; lavender drapery swags hang at top; two colorful floral swags at top of cartouche
markings: bottom center, stamped in black: [AB (?--monogram)]; LRC, stamped in brown: [(arm and hand holding pen)]
medium: Gouache and white and black chalk with brush and wash on laid paper
provenance: André Bérard, Lugt 75 (1806-1873), Paris. Lodewijk Houthakker, Lugt 3893 (1926-2008), Amsterdam. [Hazlitt, Gooden & Fox, London]. Sale, Christie's, New York, January 11, 1994, no. 67, as Italian school, late 18th century, for $3,860, to Ormond; [Flavia Ormond, London, 1994; sold, May 19, for $5,000, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1994-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Theater Design
